question: Which country's longest river is the "Kapuas River"?
explanation: Indonesia's longest river is the "Kapuas River". The Kapuas River is a river in the Indonesian part of Borneo island, at the geographic centre of Maritime Southeast Asia. At 1,143 kilometres in length, it is the longest river in Indonesia and one of the world's longest island rivers. It originates in the Muller mountain range at the centre of the island and flows west into the South China Sea creating an extended marshy delta.
